style.name: Classic Irish-Style Dry Stout
style.description: Dry stouts have an initial malt and light caramel flavor profile with a distinctive dry-roasted bitterness in the finish. Dry stouts achieve a dry-roasted character through the use of roasted barley. The emphasis of coffee-like roasted barley and a moderate degree of roasted malt aromas define much of the character. Some slight acidity may be perceived but is not necessary. European hop aroma and flavor should be low or not perceived. Dry stouts have medium-light to medium body. Fruity esters are minimal and overshadowed by malt, high hop bitterness, and roasted barley character. Diacetyl (butterscotch) should be very low or not perceived. Head retention and rich character should be part of its visual character.

breweries.name: Comrade Brewing Company
breweries.description: Welkome to the Party.  That's the motto for Comrade Brewing Company in southeast Denver.  Comrade features "back-to-basics" beers and a tongue-in-cheek nod to Communism.  But the name actually celebrates the camaraderie the craft brewing industry has become known for.

breweries.name: Franklin's Restaurant, Brewery & General Store
breweries.description: Franklins is located in the heart of historic Hyattsville in a landmark building built in the 1880’s as a blacksmith and carriage shop. Starting in 1910, the building housed the Hyattsville Hardware Co. which stayed in continuous operation until 1992. In its heyday, the hardware Co. was the center of community activity, selling everything from pots and pans to remedies for livestock maladies, chicken feed and of course, nuts and bolts. Many people bought their first washing machines and iceboxes here. Trains from Baltimore stopped right out back and delivered loads of lumber, stacks of seed, even whole houses from the Sears catalog. Neighbors gathered and talked about the weather, the schools, rising prices and changing times

data.name: Adnams Irish Stout
data.description:
Our version of an Irish Stout dry has coffee bitterness and a full white creamy head. It’s brewed with pale ale malt, roasted barley, flaked barley, wheat and a blend of Crystal, Brown, Amber and Chocolate malts and finally it’s hopped with Goldings.

How could our Head Brewer Fergus not brew an Irish Stout for our Handcrafted World beers range! Typical examples are Murphy’s, Beamish and of course Guinness.

breweries.name: Adnams Brewery
breweries.description: Adnams is one of England's oldest and most respected breweries, but despite its rich heritage and enduring fame, Adnams is not a company willing to rest on its laurels. Its continued commitment to quality and innovative packaging designs has made it Britain's fastest growing brewery over the last two years. To top it off, Adnams' head brewer was recently chosen as Britain's Brewer of the Year by a panel of his peers. The aggressive team at Adnams is raring to go and keen to make a mark in the U.S.

data.name: Adnams Oyster
data.description:
Based on a traditional porter, it is a rich, nutty, mouth filling classic stout (4.3% abv). Made from East Anglian Pale Ale malt, Crystal malt, Chocolate malt, roasted barley and English hops

Stout was enjoyed with oysters when they were part of our more common diet in 18th century taverns. Oysters could even be included in the brewing process, although we don’t use them!

Six Rivers Brewery is a proud member of Humboldt Made.
We pride ourselves on being the culmination of good food, great beer and love of a good time; providing quality and distinctive beer and menu items, utilizing local and organic ingredients whenever possible. “The Brew with a View,” is situated on the top of the hill in McKinleyville, California over looking the Pacific Ocean. data.name: Asphalt Jungle
data.description: Back in the day this spot used to be a car dealer and repair shop, when we did demo in the garage (now brewery) and several other places on site, we found layer after layer of asphalt. The name of this black as night Irish dry stout was inspired by the darkness of that rubble. Pushed with nitrogen, this beer has a nice cascade and creamy head. Low on hops, its soft and dry, but rich with roasted flavors. Yum!

data.name: Barrel Harbor Dry Stout
data.description: Our dry stout has its roots in Ireland within the St James’s Gate brewery in Dublin, the birthplace of Guinness. We make it special by taking a small percent of our wort and introducing the lactic acid bacteria naturally found on the barley husks. This soured “beer” is then boiled to kill the bacteria and infused back into the “Mother” beer. Made with five different specialty malts, English hops, and served through our nitro tap, this stout is very refreshing and delightfully hoppy compared to the traditional Irish staple.

We draw inspiration from our home brewing roots and the vibrant Vista, California brew culture. Using only the finest ingredients available, our Brewmaster draws from a decade of experience to deliver a variety of hand crafted beers. Barrel Harbor represents old world antiquity and celebrates centuries of quality brewing, so sail in and enjoy complex, flavorful beers that are sure to satisfy.

data.name: Bearded Seal
data.description:
Our brewmaster was the only person in his class at an Irish Catholic School growing up that had no Irish heritage in his bloodline. Despite that fact St. Patrick's Day is still one of his favorite holidays, he loves jet black pints topped with creamy white heads, and gets a bit surly when people say stouts are only for cold weather. This Dry-Irish Stout is a little bolder then the commercial example most people are familair with and is filled with aromas and flavors of roasted coffee and dark chocolate balanced with a nice dry finish.
Key Descriptors – Roast, Coffee, Chocolate, Dry

breweries.description: Pinthouse Pizza is a craft brewpub serving Austin's finest pizza and world class beers. The Pinthouse Pizza brewing style is a hop-forward, American-fusion style that emphasizes the flavor and aroma of the beloved hop flower without the traditional bitterness associated with hoppy beers. We are proud to be working with some of the best hop growers in the country and are excited to be showcasing these flavor profiles.

breweries.name: Begyle Brewing
breweries.description:
Begyle Brewing is a Community Supported Brewery, located in the Ravenswood Industrial Corridor, Chicago, IL.

Using a CSA (community supported agriculture) model, we will supply beer to our members via monthly subscriptions (referred to as a CSB or Beer-CSA!). In addition to the growler subscriptions we will offer growler fills to walk up customers through our retail space, as well as kegs and bottle for sale. We source many of our hops locally, you can expect the majority of our beers to include locally grown hops from Wisconsin and Michigan. We have lots of other things up our sleeves, too, like using spent grain for dog treats and sharing our space with local artists.

breweries.name: Penrose Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Art, Science, and Belgian-Inspired Brewing in Geneva, IL. 

This began with a shared obsession for skillfully brewed beer, and the starved need for cultural redirection of our lifework. Blissfully content with an opportunity to help refine a discerning palate, preferably with beer in hand, a deeper passion and commitment to the cause has evolved into Penrose Brewing Company. The cultural shift already underway is a by-product of intention and specificity. You will want to be involved.

data.description: Our Stout is a dark, black ale with a complex roasted coffee-chocolate character. It is a perfectly balanced marriage of malt sweetness and hops, a light body with a gorgeous head. The hops used provide a traditional mellow bitterness in a supporting role. The finish is smooth and dry. Our stout beer is brewed in the traditional ‘dry stout style’ and is very approachable.

breweries.name: Bitter Ester's Brewhouse
breweries.description: We are a Small Artisan Nano-Brewery!  We specialize in English inspired American Ales and Belgian-style Farmhouse Ales.  We use only the finest barley, grown and malted all over the world.  We use hops that are grown all over the world as well.  If you are noticing a theme our beers are unique to each time we brew therefore we need to tap the expert farmers and craftsman worldwide to get these wonderful and unique ingredients.  We have six ales on draft at any one time and our Dry stout and Brown Ale are the only reoccurring beers.  We brew farmhouse ales that are different every batch we brew.

breweries.name: Bentley Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Thank you for your interest in Bentley Brewing and the Dark Horse Tavern. This is a family owned pub and brew house located at 12 Crane Street in Southbridge, Ma. Our goal is to offer a warm and inviting atmosphere where you can savor our array of freshly brewed beer on tap. We also offer a fully stocked bar for those wishing a more exotic cocktail. To accompany these libations we have a delectable selection of pub fare for your enjoyment.

As we gear up for the Dark Horse Tavern's grand opening in mid-June, Bentley Brewing, along with the help of our expert brew master, Tim Daley, will begin production of our four signature beers on tap. In subsequent weeks, we will be expanding our offerings to include four additional beers, as well as two cask ales, which will complete our on-site brewing selection.

Located just off Main Street in Southbridge, we are within easy access to major routes I-84 and the Mass Pike. Parking for over 150 cars and handicapped accessible, we offer outside dining on our spacious patio overlooking the scenic Quinebaug River, multiple large flat screen televisions broadcasting the latest sporting events throughout the bar, gaming options that include championship dartboards and a pool table, and live entertainment on Saturday evenings. You can also look into our brewing area where all the magic happens and Tim would be happy to answer any and all questions and we welcome your suggestions for future offerings. We accept reservations to accommodate parties of 30-70 guests in our conference room that includes a private bar and optional catering.

We are confident that after experiencing our locally grown and freshly prepared food, our fantastic brew and the exceptional service of our dedicated staff, you will make Bentley Brewing and the Dark Horse Tavern your favorite destination spot. We look forward to welcoming you and your guests in person at our riverside location at 12 Crane Street.

data.name: Black Gold Stout
data.description:
This extra dry stout flaunts a roasted aroma and is a mainstay on St. Patrick’s day. The big flavors of chocolate and black malts coat the mouth with roasted maltiness that will linger on and on. Creamy and very dark, Black Gold is one of our best brews.

Grain: 2 Row, Caramel 80, Caramel 60, Flaked Barley, Flaked Oats, Black Barley, Black Malt, Lactose
Hops: Nugget, UK Fuggels

data.name: Black Hawk Stout
data.description: Black Hawk Stout retains the big traditional flavors of an Irish-style stout and yet offers a refreshing dry crispness that is rare in many dark beers. Black Hawk Stout is replete with a rich, roasted malt flavor that makes this not-so-heavy stout, creamy and ever so smooth. It has a subtlety that surprises and converts even the most reticent stout drinker.

breweries.name: River City Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The River City Brewing Company in Sacramento, California is a fusion of brewing expertise, culinary artistry, experienced & friendly staff and relaxing yet vibrant ambiance.

The beers brewed here are traditional and innovated. With over 22 different ales and lagers brewed throughout the year, you are assured of a great selection and a satisfied palate. Visit our "Beer Offerings" page to view the current quiver of ales and lagers.

The California cuisine at RCBC is extraordinary, but don't take our word for it, we will let you make up your own mind after you try our signature Eggplant Napoleon appetizer or the Asiago Garlic Crusted Chicken or any of our Wood Fired Pizzas!

The open and spacious architecture with 20' ceilings creates a lively and fun atmosphere, or you can enjoy a more quiet tone in our banquet room that seats up to 50 people. If you want to, you can perch your party on our mezzanine (holds up to 25 people) for a view of the whole restaurant.

data.name: Black Rock Irish Stout
data.description:
The ‘Black Rock’ is a landmark for mariners at the outermost part of Dungarvan harbour, situated just between the Copper Coast and Helvick Head.
This is a full flavoured, smooth, dry stout that has been described on more than one occasion as “the way stout used to taste”. Made from roasted barley which gives a rich, chocolatey flavour complemented by herbal hints and notes of vanilla and aniseed. This is a medium-bodied stout with a light carbonation and a smooth mouthfeel.
Ideally this stout should be served in the traditional south eastern way which is ‘off the shelf’ — ie. at room temperature.

breweries.name: Dungarvan Brewing
breweries.description:
Dungarvan Brewing Company was launched in April 2010 after a couple of years spent researching, planning and developing by the four founders.
The philosophy of the brewery is one of purity — we keep the beer in its purest form by bottle-conditioning it. It isn’t filtered, isn’t pasteurised and is naturally carbonated so there is minimum interference with it between raw ingredients and finished product. We always start with the best quality ingredients including; Maris Otter malt, full leaf hop cones and the limestone rich water of West Waterford.
Our brewer strives for quality and consistency across every stage of the brew, working hard to ensure that each bottle achieves the high standards he has set. All the beers are craft brewed in small batches and by its artisan nature this can lead to slight variations by batch.
The brewhouse is a 6bbl plant made by PBC Brewery Installations, the UK’s top micro brewery installer and is ideally suited to the bottle-conditioned traditional ales that we brew.
Bottling is currently done by hand with a four-head filler with plans to upgrade this to an automated system in the coming months.

data.name: Black Stuff
data.description: A nod to CLB’s Irish heritage, Black Stuff will instantly transport you to the mother country. Deep roasted malt character dances with hints of chocolate and a subtle smokiness. The finish is smooth and creamy with a touch of sweetness that gives way to the traditional dry finish. Slainte!

breweries.name: Crystal Lake Brewing
breweries.description:
We love craft beer, and Crystal Lake Brewing is all about the beer. We love drinking great beers, we love making them, and we can't wait to share them with you. Our goal is simple, to produce world-­class beers right here in Crystal Lake.

Starting this summer, you'll be able to enjoy Crystal Lake Brewing Co. beer at restaurants and bars throughout Illinois, but we'd also like you to come visit us in person in our on-­premises tap room. Here, you can sample our beers in an open, relaxed space, then sit back and enjoy a pint or two of your favorite, all while admiring the brewhouse.

The Crystal Lake Brewing Co. is a production brewery, and we're totally focused on producing top-­notch beers. We won’t be serving any food in the tap room, but you'll be welcome to bring it in with you or order delivery from one of the nearby eateries. From time to time, expect to see a food truck parked just outside the front door, where you can grab a casual bite.

The tap room will always be pouring our best known beers, but you'll always find "pilot" brews, too. These unique beers will be brewed in smaller quantities and will be available only here at the brewery. Something new will always be on tap.

Of course, brewery tours will be offered, too.

Look for "CLB" beer at your favorite tavern or restaurant this summer, or at a local summertime festival. Don’t forget to come on in and visit us in the tap room. We’ll have a pint waiting for you. Cheers!

data.name: Blackout Stout
data.description: Our rich, dark stout is made from three types of select malts and two types of hops. We add heavy, flavorful barley flakes to our stout to give it a thick body and full, intensely rich taste. Like a taste of Ireland, brewed with our pure spring water, stout yeast and finished to perfection. LA Times listed Blackout Stout as one of their “Beers of the Month” as reported here.

data.name: Blackout Stout
data.description:
Brewed in the tradition of the classic Irish Dry Stouts, our take is smooth and roasty with a long dry finish.  A legendary combo when paired with fresh oysters; try it with mussels, clams or calamari -- the flavors perfectly compliment the briny sweetness of the shellfish.
 
Add it to hearty soups, stews, and roasts for a wonderful enhancement, then serve it alongside them.  Also stunning with Lox or any smoked fish, as well as sturdy cheddars and blue cheeses.
 
It's our smoothest of brews -- treat yourself!

data.name: Breakside Irish Stout
data.description:
We’re very proud of this dark beer. A medal winner at both the Great American Beer Festival and the World Beer Cup, this stout is a showcase of roasted malt character. It features notes of coffee and chocolate in every sip. What’s amazing about this beer is how easy it is to drink. At under 4.5% ABV, this is a session stout that can refresh on a cool Fall day. The lower alcohol allows the grain flavors to shine, making it a food-friendly stout that can match a wide range of dishes. It’s as true an Irish stout as you’ll find anywhere in the United States today.

Award-winning Irish-style stout. A flavorful, sessionable dark ale.

data.name: Brooklyn Dry Irish Stout
data.description:
The Irish Stout beer style was once produced by dozens of breweries in Ireland. These days it is only produced by three major breweries in Ireland, none of them Irish-owned, though several small breweries and brewpubs make stout as well. People are often surprised to hear that Irish stouts are among the lightest beers on draft, both in alcohol and in calories. These beers were originally designed as “session pints”, a term denoting beers that one can stick with for a long evening. These days, the major producers of Irish Stout dissolve nitrogen into the beer to produce the trademark head, a practice that started in 1960.
Brooklyn Irish Stout is brewed the old-fashioned way, without the nitrogen addition. A large portion of the grain is roasted like coffee beans, developing the typical color and flavor of this beer. Aside from British pale malts, the beer includes caramel malts, black patent malt, unmalted black barley and a proportion of flaked raw barley, which helps the beer develop a beautiful, thick natural head. The famous East Kent Golding hop lends to the earthy aroma. The beer is neither filtered, nor fined and has a light, brisk carbonation. The blend of grains gives the beer an espresso-like bite, followed by coffee and chocolate flavors. At 4.2% ABV, this is among the lightest beers we make, and one of our favorites. Be sure to serve it with “two fingers” of foam, and enjoy the flavor of Brooklyn Irish Stout. Slainte!

breweries.name: Brooklyn Brewery
breweries.description: Since its founding in 1988, The Brooklyn Brewery brews flavorful beers that enrich the life, tradition and culture of the communities it serves. Its award-winning roster of year round, season and specialty products have gained the Brewery notoriety as one of the top craft beer producers in the world. Brooklyn beers are currently distributed in 25 states and 17 countries, and throughout 2011 the brewery underwent an expansion that will double overall capacity by 2013. In addition to facilitating community meetings at its event space, brewery employees serve on not-for-profit boards, including the Prospect Park Alliance, the Open Space Alliance, Transportation Alternatives and the Brooklyn Historical Society. Each year the company supports many charitable and arts organizations including BAM, Brooklyn Museum and MoMA, and partners with food purveyors across the country to produce beer dinners and tasting events. The Brewery is open to the public Monday-Thursday from 5-7pm for reservation-only Small Batch tours, Friday evening for Happy Hour, and Saturdays and Sundays for Tours and Tastings. For more info, visit BrooklynBrewery.com and follow @BrooklynBrewery on Twitter.

breweries.description: Welcome to Camden Town Brewery. London now has it's very own craft beer and as the name suggests, it's being brewed in Camden. Using only the freshest ingredients and no brain aching chemicals, we'll be brewing lager, wheat beer and pale ale. The best city in the world deserves the best beer and now it's right in your backyard.

data.name: Canonball Doyle
data.description: A malt backbone, with caramel malts for depth and a touch of roasted barley for color. EKG and Target make up the hops schedule.

style.name: Classic Irish-Style Dry Stout
style.description: Dry stouts have an initial malt and light caramel flavor profile with a distinctive dry-roasted bitterness in the finish. Dry stouts achieve a dry-roasted character through the use of roasted barley. The emphasis of coffee-like roasted barley and a moderate degree of roasted malt aromas define much of the character. Some slight acidity may be perceived but is not necessary. European hop aroma and flavor should be low or not perceived. Dry stouts have medium-light to medium body. Fruity esters are minimal and overshadowed by malt, high hop bitterness, and roasted barley character. Diacetyl (butterscotch) should be very low or not perceived. Head retention and rich character should be part of its visual character.

breweries.name: Union Brewing Company
breweries.description: At Union Brewing Company, our artisan ales are hand crafted two barrels at a time using time honored traditions, natural ingredients and traditional methods. Our beers are never filtered or force carbonated. They condition and carbonate naturally in casks and are hand drawn by authentic beer engines at the perfect drinking temperature to maximize all the flavors. (No, they are not warm!) We really like beer, and we love cask conditioned real ales. We think you will too!

data.name: Captain Patrick Irish Stout
data.description: This Irish Stout is named after the great Captain Patrick who saved the land of Ire from evil. Dark in color with a thick head and creamy taste from a nitro tap - the brew has a traditional roasted malt flavor, hints of coffee and chocolate, and a very smooth finish. The hop bitterness is mild yet noticeable and complements the natural roasted malt flavor well.

data.name: Captain Stout
data.description: The Captain is leader of a fire crew. This beer takes charge of your taste buds with its rich flavor. Roasty malt character that has hints of chocolate and coffee which balances the smooth, velvety finish. The thick, creamy head lasts and lasts, leaving lace in your glass as your beer disappears. This beer pairs well with food. Great with dinner or as breakfast or even with a rich vanilla-bean ice cream.

breweries.name: Alpine Beer Company
breweries.description:
Alpine Beer Company opened its doors in the fall of 2002. Years before, an interest in craft brewing developed into an actual goal for the future. There were years of home brew competitions, brew science classes, and extended beer runs thinly disguised as vacations. 
The brewery went through an expansion starting in late 2008 and became operational in mid 2009. Four double sized fermentors were installed in an old garage behind the current brewery. A cold box was erected adjacent to the garage and a bottling machine with a nice labeler are housed there too. There is a small barrel shed on the shady, north side of the garage.

data.name: Cauldron
data.description: A dry irish stout with a wild twist. Brewed with 6.66% soured wort and served only on nitro, this stout is smooth, creamy and roasty with notes of dark chocolate and coffee and just a hint of complexity from the small portion of tart wort.

style.name: Classic Irish-Style Dry Stout
style.description: Dry stouts have an initial malt and light caramel flavor profile with a distinctive dry-roasted bitterness in the finish. Dry stouts achieve a dry-roasted character through the use of roasted barley. The emphasis of coffee-like roasted barley and a moderate degree of roasted malt aromas define much of the character. Some slight acidity may be perceived but is not necessary. European hop aroma and flavor should be low or not perceived. Dry stouts have medium-light to medium body. breweries.name: Urban Artifact
breweries.description: All our beers are wild. That means, in one way or the other, each and every one of our beers is brewed with locally caught wild yeast, bacteria, or mixed cultures of both. With micro-floral creatures such as Saccharomyces, Lactobacillus, Pediococcus, and Brettanomyces, it is the brewer’s job to get these wild microorganisms to create flavors that are tart and crisp, tropical and wild, and downright funky. It is the ultimate way to truly express a sense of place in our beers, to create beers that form with you a lasting experience, that have the effect of taking you to our brewery, taproom and venue with every sip. At the end of the day, here in the brewery, it is all about our microscopic wild friends.

data.name: Celtic Fury
data.description: First brewed in 2005, this traditional Irish Stout calms the ire of the clans with it’s delicious roast coffee aroma, smooth, creamy mouthfeel, and exquisitely dry finish with subtle notes of coffee and chocolate. Raise a bottle or a pint of this hearty, deep garnet masterpiece instead of arms and all grievances will be forgiven.

breweries.name: DuClaw Brewing Company
breweries.description: At DuClaw Brewing Company, we are very proud of our beers. Our beers have received their fair share of recognition over the years, but even though we put quality first, fun is never far behind ... just look at the names of our beers. How do we come up with them? All we have to say is that there is a whole lot of creativity in those vats of beer just dying to come out, and we never stop till we get it right.

breweries.name: Timeless Pints Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Lakewood's first microbrewery! 

On Father's Day, several years ago, my son and I purchased a home brewing kit for my husband. As an Engineer and a lover of craft beer, he was excited to experiment with his own concoctions. Since his first trial run, he's produced multiple variety of stouts, ales, lagers and IPA's as well as very happy friends, family and neighbors. His love for the unique keeps him constantly in search of "new and different" ingredients and the hope of a perfect combination.

One hot July evening, some friends disclosed they were embarking on a new restaurant idea. They asked Chris (my husband) if he would brew the beer specifically for their new endeavor. The ABC frowns on beer sold without the proper licensing and selling from the kitchen counter is not a viable option. Thus a new venture began.

What was once a dream is now a reality and we can now bring our own craft beer to our local Lakewood/Long Beach community. You'll find us just behind the Long Beach Airport.

breweries.name: Full Moon Brewery
breweries.description: The Full Moon Brewery specializes in British and Irish style beers. We use Marris Otter malt as our base and then add various combinations of Black Patent, Brown malt, Crystal malt, and Roasted Barley depending on the individual beer. We use Fuggles, East Kent Golding and Challenger hops. Our brew house is a one barrel RIMS system filling one and two barrel fermenters.

data.name: Chuli Stout
data.description: Over its long history, stout has served many purposes, from a doctor-recommended cure-all to an aperitif for Russian royalty. Somewhere in the middle is Chuli Stout, a dry Irish style stout, which takes its name from the mighty Chulitna River. An ample amount of roasted barley imparts dry, coffee-like flavors, while flaked barley adds smoothness and body. And if that weren’t enough, Chuli Stout is conditioned and served with nitrogen, amplifying smoothness and creating that rich, dense, classic stout pour.

breweries.name: The Saint Louis Brewery (Schlafly)
breweries.description:
Schlafly is the brand name of beers produced by the Saint Louis Brewery, Inc. Currently, all beers produced by this brewery are under the Schlafly brand. Located in St. Louis, Missouri, it is widely available in Eastern Missouri and Southern Illinois. Schlafly brand beers are distributed to the following states: Missouri, Kansas, Illinois, Indiana, Kentucky, Tennessee, North Western Mississippi, North Virgina, and Washington, DC.

The Saint Louis Brewery, Inc. was incorporated in 1989. It was founded by Dan Kopman and Tom Schlafly,[1] a lawyer and nephew of political activist Phyllis Schlafly, although she is not involved with the brewery in any way. Their goal was to create quality local microbrew beer.
